Summary:

Chapter 1: Attraction of Small Objects
Notes:

    Some content warnings in end notes, just in case.

    Alright, so this story has grown beyond my wildest imaginings, both in length and audience, so I wanted to make a better introductory note to give people some relevant information, if you're curious

    1) To be on the safe side, IGG is rated M for language, violence, and some dark themes
    2) IGG contains death and violence. I do not consider the death major or the violence graphic, but there is a degree of subjectivity to those terms, hence the use of both "no archive warnings apply" and "creator chose not to use archive warnings."
    3) The angst in this story is heavy at times, or so I have been told. That said, the narrative as a whole is meant to be about healing, ultimately a source of hope. Keep in mind, though, that healing itself can be an incredibly painful and slow process. The "hurt/comfort" and "healing" tags are pretty closely linked to that "slow build" tag. Take care of yourself if you're sensitive to depictions of mental health issues!
    4) Updates are currently slow and irregular. IGG is no longer my primary focus - I'm spending most of my time and energy working on my health and an original novel. With that said, no matter how far apart updates may be, IGG is not discontinued. If it ever is, you'll know. I'll publish all my notes, snippets, and plans - and trust me, there's a lot of them. IGG comes with guaranteed closure, if not proper completion.

    Okay, that should be it. Hopefully I haven't scared anyone away or anything lmao. I just have a compulsive need to tell people What's Going On and the note I wrote 100k+ ago just wasn't cutting it for me anymore
    (updated 4/28/23)

A straightforward fighter. Limited strategy. Physically strong even without quirk. Is it worth it?
